match.title: 3rd ODI
match.statusText: South Africa won by 7 wickets (with 94 balls remaining)

image.caption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium

headshotImage.caption: AB de Villiers headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: AB de Villiers headshot

dismissalText.long: c de Villiers b M Morkel
dismissalText.commentary: Shahriar Nafees c de Villiers b M Morkel 25 (33b 3x4 0x6 53m) SR: 75.75

dismissalComment.html: Nafees  is gone too. This one too came in from round the wicket and again Nafees was cramped up and tried to play it quite similarly to the previous delivery : opening the bat face and trying to steer but this one bounced more and took the edge

headshotImage.caption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nazimuddin c Smith b JA Morkel 20 (30b 3x4 0x6 43m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: OMG! What happened there? They are in a suicide mode here. He walked right across the stumps and tried to slog a length delivery across the line but only skied it for Smith to get under it at midwicket. Horrible shot. What was he thinking? Was he thinking?

headshotImage.caption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tamim Iqbal headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal headshot

dismissalComment.html: Tamim's in disbelief but he has to walk... Pitches on a good length a shade outside the offstump, Tamim pokes his bat out and there's a sound before the ball reaches the keeper. De Villiers the rest appeal and umpire Nadir Shah is convinced. Replays show the ball clipping the pad on the way through.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Dust to Ash es . Death by aggression. Full in length, on the middle stump and he goes for a ugly heave and can only manage to send it to mid-on. Ashraful is livid with himself. But the deed has been done. Just 17 runs in this series. What a waste of a talent.

OMG! What happened there? They are in a suicide mode here. He walked right across the stumps and tried to slog a length delivery across the line but only skied it for Smith to get under it at midwicket. Horrible shot. What was he thinking? Was he thinking?

headshotImage.caption: Mashrafe Mortaza headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mashrafe Mortaza headshot

dismissalComment.html: The ninth wicket is down. It was pretty short in length, outside the off stump and he top-edged a cut to the 'keeper

headshotImage.caption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot

dismissalComment.html: One more down. Shakib is cleaned up. Flighted from round the stumps, full, he tried to whip it to midwicket, missed and the ball bounded off the pad and on to the stumps.

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Another swipe across the line and de Villiers takes a very sharp catch. Razzak top-edged a intended slog and de Villiers managed to hold on to a tough chance.
Bangladesh innings has been terminated. This time the batsman walks after nicking to de Villiers. Flighted around the off stump and edged behind

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Ashraful c Amla b JA Morkel 9 (10b 1x4 0x6 14m) SR: 90

dismissalComment.html: Dust to Ash es . Death by aggression. Full in length, on the middle stump and he goes for a ugly heave and can only manage to send it to mid-on. Ashraful is livid with himself. But the deed has been done. Just 17 runs in this series. What a waste of a talent.

headshotImage.caption: AB de Villiers headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: AB de Villiers headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Raqibul Hasan run out (Duminy/de Villiers) 12 (30b 1x4 0x6 36m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: The third umpire has given Raqibul run out. Dhiman went back and pushed towards covers, Duminy swooped in and fired in a throw to the 'keeper who took the bails off. There was a doubt whether the bails had come off before the batsman had dragged the bat inside the crease but on careful and repeated viewing, the umpire presses the red button.

headshotImage.caption: Paul Harris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Paul Harris player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dhiman Ghosh b Harris 3 (14b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 21.42

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Harris slips in the arm ball on middle and off, Ghosh moves back and tries to cut, he gets beaten for pace and misses, Bangladesh are seven down, an abject performance so far

headshotImage.longCaption: Farhad Reza player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers b Farhad Reza 40 (37b 7x4 0x6 53m) SR: 108.1

dismissalComment.html: done in by the nip-backer. It cut in from outside off stump, the bat came down outside the line and it hit the pad in front of middle and went on to disturb the furniture. He would have been out lbw even if it didn't go on to hit the stumps. But a refreshing innings from de Villiers. He came in and immediately upped the ante.

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Herschelle Gibbs player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Herschelle Gibbs player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: caught at covers. It landed on the off and middle and turned away from Gibbs who  tried to force it off the back foot but hit it straight to covers. He was not in the right position and the ball turned a bit more than he thought.

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: trapped in front. Quicker armer, on the middle stump line and it zipped off the track to strike him in front of the stumps.

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Sweeps the series with a six. Emphatic win. He went down the track, getting outside off in the process and lofted it over long-on. With that South Africa move to no 1 position in the ODI rankings.

commentPostTextItems.html: Man of the Match: Albie Morkel
Player of the series Graeme Smith

Smith: I have been around for a fair bit now obviously the responsibility is on me with a few youngsters coming in the team. This has been a great preparation for the India tour. We have done it the hard way here on slightly under-prepared wickets. We have bowled, batted and fielded well. We have lots of respect for Indian team, they have lots of experience. We have had a great time here.
That's it from us. Thanks for logging on. Alvida!

commentTextItems.html: walks to the off stump and on drives to midwicket
spins down the leg side and Dhiman can't gather it
leans forward to drive to extra cover

headshotImage.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot

commentTextItems.html: stays back to punch it to mid-on
just outside off stump, defended to the off side
on the off and middle, nudged to the on side

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers b Farhad Reza 40 (37b 7x4 0x6 53m) SR: 108.1

commentTextItems.html: done in by the nip-backer. It cut in from outside off stump, the bat came down outside the line and it hit the pad in front of middle and went on to disturb the furniture. He would have been out lbw even if it didn't go on to hit the stumps. But a refreshing innings from de Villiers. He came in and immediately upped the ante.

commentPreTextItems.html: Felix "Wanted to mention that Smith reaches 5000 ODI runs. Now he has 5K runs in Tests and ODIs. Well done, mate!"

commentTextItems.html: shapes in from outside off, defended on the front foot

headshotImage.caption: Farhad Reza player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Farhad Reza player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: slog sweep over midwicket. They are finishing it in a hurry. Off he went outside off stump, went down on his knee and fetched it from outside off and sent it soaring over the boundary.
goes back to force a length delivery to sweeper cover
turned sharply from middle and leg, de Villiers was shaping to pull but adjusts to punch it to covers

commentPreTextItems.html: Nel comes out with the drinks for the batsman. Good to see him out there.

commentTextItems.html: turns in from outside off, dabbed to fine leg
overpitched and he mistimes a drive to covers

commentTextItems.html: leans forward to drive to covers
on the stumps, pushed to mid-on
Even better. Super shot this. He stood up tall and fisted a short-of-length delivery on the up and to the left of mid-off.
full pitched outside off stump, de Villiers knives it through extra cover. Fab shot.

dismissalComment.html: Dust to Ash es . Death by aggression. Full in length, on the middle stump and he goes for a ugly heave and can only manage to send it to mid-on. Ashraful is livid with himself. But the deed has been done. Just 17 runs in this series. What a waste of a talent.

headshotImage.longCaption: AB de Villiers headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Raqibul Hasan run out (Duminy/de Villiers) 12 (30b 1x4 0x6 36m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: The third umpire has given Raqibul run out. Dhiman went back and pushed towards covers, Duminy swooped in and fired in a throw to the 'keeper who took the bails off. There was a doubt whether the bails had come off before the batsman had dragged the bat inside the crease but on careful and repeated viewing, the umpire presses the red button.

headshotImage.caption: Paul Harris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Paul Harris player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dhiman Ghosh b Harris 3 (14b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 21.42

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Harris slips in the arm ball on middle and off, Ghosh moves back and tries to cut, he gets beaten for pace and misses, Bangladesh are seven down, an abject performance so far

headshotImage.longCaption: Shahriar Nafees player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Nafees  is gone too. This one too came in from round the wicket and again Nafees was cramped up and tried to play it quite similarly to the previous delivery : opening the bat face and trying to steer but this one bounced more and took the edge

headshotImage.caption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tamim Iqbal headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal headshot

dismissalComment.html: Tamim's in disbelief but he has to walk... Pitches on a good length a shade outside the offstump, Tamim pokes his bat out and there's a sound before the ball reaches the keeper. De Villiers the rest appeal and umpire Nadir Shah is convinced. Replays show the ball clipping the pad on the way through.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Dust to Ash es . Death by aggression. Full in length, on the middle stump and he goes for a ugly heave and can only manage to send it to mid-on. Ashraful is livid with himself. But the deed has been done. Just 17 runs in this series. What a waste of a talent.

OMG! What happened there? They are in a suicide mode here. He walked right across the stumps and tried to slog a length delivery across the line but only skied it for Smith to get under it at midwicket. Horrible shot. What was he thinking? Was he thinking?

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Ashraful b Abdur Razzak
dismissalText.commentary: Herschelle Gibbs c Mohammad Ashraful b Abdur Razzak 10 (17b 1x4 0x6 22m) SR: 58.82

dismissalComment.html: caught at covers. It landed on the off and middle and turned away from Gibbs who  tried to force it off the back foot but hit it straight to covers. He was not in the right position and the ball turned a bit more than he thought.

dismissalText.commentary: Alviro Petersen lbw b Mosharraf Hossain 24 (54b 3x4 0x6 54m) SR: 44.44

dismissalComment.html: trapped in front. Quicker armer, on the middle stump line and it zipped off the track to strike him in front of the stumps.

headshotImage.caption: Farhad Reza player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Farhad Reza player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers b Farhad Reza 40 (37b 7x4 0x6 53m) SR: 108.1

dismissalComment.html: done in by the nip-backer. It cut in from outside off stump, the bat came down outside the line and it hit the pad in front of middle and went on to disturb the furniture. He would have been out lbw even if it didn't go on to hit the stumps. But a refreshing innings from de Villiers. He came in and immediately upped the ante.

notes: Bangladesh: 50 runs in 13.3 overs (85 balls), Extras 5
Bangladesh: 100 runs in 24.5 overs (157 balls), Extras 12
Innings Break: Bangladesh - 143/10 in 42.5 overs (Farhad Reza 20)
South Africa: 50 runs in 16.5 overs (101 balls), Extras 1
Drinks: South Africa - 58/1 in 19.0 overs (GC Smith 23, AN Petersen 24)
South Africa: 100 runs in 27.2 overs (165 balls), Extras 2
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 58 balls (GC Smith 24, AB de Villiers 27, Ex 1)
GC Smith: 50 off 86 balls (3 x 4, 1 x 6)

stories.title: 'Beating India one of our main goals' - Arthur
stories.subTitle: South Africa in Bangladesh 2007-08
stories.seoTitle: 'Beating India one of our main goals' - Arthur
stories.summary: Mickey Arthur, the South Africa coach, has said that it is important to be No. 1 in the one-day rankings but what his team really wants is to beat India in the upcoming three-Test series

stories.title: South Africa No.1 after clean sweep
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: A comprehensive all-round rout of Bangladesh in the third and final one-dayer in Mirpur not only sealed a 3-0 series win for South Africa but also propelled them to the top of the ICC one-day rankings

galleries.title: Clean sweep puts South Africa No. 1
galleries.subTitle: Bangladesh v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Mirpur

image.caption: Albie Morkel celebrates while Tamim Iqbal expresses his disappointment at the umpire's decision
image.longCaption: Albie Morkel celebrates while Tamim Iqbal expresses his disappointment at the umpire's decision, Bangladesh v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Mirpur, March 14, 2008

stories.title: 'Beating India one of our main goals' - Arthur
stories.subTitle: South Africa in Bangladesh 2007-08
stories.seoTitle: 'Beating India one of our main goals' - Arthur
stories.summary: Mickey Arthur, the South Africa coach, has said that it is important to be No. 1 in the one-day rankings but what his team really wants is to beat India in the upcoming three-Test series

recentReportStory.title: South Africa No.1 after clean sweep
recentReportStory.subTitle: Bangladesh v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
recentReportStory.summary: A comprehensive all-round rout of Bangladesh in the third and final one-dayer in Mirpur not only sealed a 3-0 series win for South Africa but also propelled them to the top of the ICC one-day rankings
recentReportStory.credit: Kanishkaa Balachandran is a staff writer at Cricinfo

3.title: 2nd ODI
3.statusText: South Africa won by 7 wickets (with 11 balls remaining)
